p: Nose and mouth swabs, the most widespread samples for CoV-2 diagnostics, require trained personnel to procure samples. However, the study by To and coworkers recommends saliva as an easy-to-procure, noninvasive sample not requiring any trained personnel in COVID-19 screening. They detected CoV-2 in 11 out of 12 patient samples and also could trace the declining titers post-hospitalization (To et al. 2020).
